ie.gmit.sw.data

Class ServiceData

  • java.lang.Object
    • ie.gmit.sw.data.ServiceData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ServiceData
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class used for save all the different options that can be chose for perform a cosine calculator service.

    Include files needed and parameters for all objects needed for run the program.

    Files are initiated to null, parameters to a default value.

    Author:
    Jose I. Retamal
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CosineCalculatorType getCosineType()
      Cosine calculator type can be normal, which is fine for no so big amount of shingles counted(most of the time will be related to the size of the file but also depends on the size of the shingles).Normal is faster but may give funny values if the size is to big.

        public boolean setQueryFile(java.io.File queryFile)

        Returns:

      • getCosineType

        public CosineCalculatorType getCosineType()
        Cosine calculator type can be normal, which is fine for no so big amount of shingles counted(most of the time will be related to the size of the file but also depends on the size of the shingles).Normal is faster but may give funny values if the size is to big. Big can hold bigger size but is slower
        Returns:
        the cosineType

      • setCosineType

        public void setCosineType(CosineCalculatorType cosineType)
        Cosine calculator type can be normal, which is fine for no so big amount of shingles counted(most of the time will be related to the size of the file but also depends on the size of the shingles).Normal is faster but may give funny values if the size is to big. Big can hold bigger size but is slower.
        Parameters:
        cosineType - the cosineType to set

      • getFiles

        public java.io.File[] getFiles()
        Use for get all files to process.
        Returns:
        Returns all files that can be read from subject directory. null if the subject directory is null, mean not set yet.
